entry.title: Costa Rican airport reopens after volcano eruption
entry.summary: The country's public education ministry suspended classes Friday at 12 schools near the volcano.

entry.title: Costa Rica reopens capital airport after volcano eruption
Costa Rica reopens capital airport after volcano eruption
entry.summary: The Turrialba volcano erupted three times Thursday and state observers recorded a smaller eruption Friday morning.

entry.title: Chile volcano sends spectacular pillar of fire into night sky (VIDEO)
entry.summary: "The volcano is quiet now, very calm. You wouldn't know anything had happened,"he said.

entry.title: Chile volcano erupts, shooting lava into the sky
Over 3000 people evacuated as Chile's Villarrica volcano erupts
entry.summary:
The 2800m Villarrica volcano, one of Chile's most active, began erupting around 3am local time, prompting authorities to declare a red alert and cancel classes in schools, the National Emergency Office said.

As sirens sounded, Chilean TV footage showed lava spilling from the volcano near the popular tourist resort of Pucon, about 800 kilometres south of the capital Santiago.

People leave their houses after Villarica volcano erupted near Pucon, Chile, early on Tuesday morning.

entry.title: Thousands Flee As Villarrica Volcano Erupts In Southern Chile
entry.summary: Picture of the Villarrica volcano, located near Villarrica 1200 km from Santiago, in southern Chile, which began erupting on March 3, 2015 forcing the evacuation of some 3,000 people in nearby villages.

entry.title: Villarica volcano in southern Chile erupts, thousands evacuated
entry.summary:
"I've never seen a volcano erupt and it was spewing lava and ash hundreds of meters into the air. Lightning was striking down at the volcano from the ash cloud that formed from the eruption."

The eruption "was something beautiful and amazing. We're still a bit shocked but the volcano has calmed down so I'm going to continue with my vacation," Alejandra Paz Bustos, 29, said as she sunbathed at nearby lake Villarrica.

Officials said late Tuesday that about 15,000 people living in rural areas near the volcano were suffering water shortages after the eruption, and kept the red alert for nearby areas.

entry.title: Volcano in southern Chile erupts, thousands evacuated
entry.summary:
Local media showed images of the volcano bursting at the top, glowing in the dark amid heavy smoke and rivers of lava.

Tourists flock to the area around Villarrica for outdoor activities like kayaking, horseback riding, fishing and hiking around the volcano, which last had a major eruption in 1984.

entry.title: Volcano in southern Chile erupts, thousands evacuated
entry.summary: Chilean authorities had issued an orange alert on Monday because of increased activity at the volcano.

entry.title: Villarica volcano in southern Chile erupts, thousands evacuated
entry.summary: The 9,000 foot (2,847-meter) volcano is located in Chile's central valley about 400 miles (670 kilometers) south of Santiago.

entry.title: Chile's Villarica volcano erupts
entry.summary: More than 3,000 people have been evacuated from the volcano's vicinity.

entry.title: Volcano erupts in southern Chile, thousands flee
entry.summary:
The Villarica volcano erupts on March 3 near Pucon, Chile.

The Villarrica volcano began erupting around 3 a.m. March 3.

The Villarrica volcano erupted around 3 a.m. local time, according to the National Emergency Office, which issued a red alert and ordered evacuations.
